titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Rush Rhees, [17. 1. 1951]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original an der ÖNB (Autogr. 1286/21-6); Kopie im BA.

div.p: I write this with pencil because I'm in bed; I have been bad for quite a time. ‒ I really don't remember whether I thanked you for the nice socks you gave me at Christmas. I'm even more muddled these days than usual. Thanks anyway. I was very glad to get a present from you. The trouble partly was that I was ill at Christmas lying in my good doctor's house at Cambridge. There, by the way, I read a book which interested me & which I liked. It's called "Rommel" & is a kind of biography of the German general written by a brigadier Young. It seemed to me rather well written & with great fairness.
I hope you will have a moderately good Lent Term. Good wishes as always,
